title: Use plain language
description: Write in plain, everyday language to make content understandable for the widest audience. Avoid jargon unless it's necessary and well-defined.

examples.incorrect: Utilize the interface to commence the initialization process.
examples.correct: Use the interface to start the process.

source: Microsoft Style Guide, Plain Language section

title: Avoid ambiguous terms
description: Replace vague terms like 'soon', 'appropriate', or 'as needed' with specific, measurable descriptions.

examples.correct: Restart the system after the installation finishes.

title: Avoid filler words
description: Remove unnecessary words that don't add meaning, such as 'basically', 'actually', or 'in order to'.

examples.incorrect: In order to save the file, click Save.
examples.correct: To save the file, click Save.

title: Use short sentences
description: Limit sentences to one main idea to improve readability and comprehension.

examples.incorrect: The system automatically backs up your files to the cloud, which means you can restore them if your device is lost, stolen, or damaged, and it also lets you share them easily.
examples.correct: The system automatically backs up your files to the cloud. You can restore them if your device is lost, stolen, or damaged. You can also share them easily.

title: Avoid nested clauses
description: Break up sentences with multiple embedded clauses to prevent confusion.

examples.incorrect: The user, who has administrator privileges, which are required for this operation, must log in first.
examples.correct: Only administrators can perform this operation. Log in with an administrator account first.

title: Be consistent with terminology
description: Use the same word or phrase to describe the same concept throughout your content.

examples.incorrect: Click the Submit button to send your form. Press the Send button to confirm.
examples.correct: Click Submit to send your form.

title: Avoid cultural references
description: Do not use idioms, slang, or cultural references that might not be understood by all audiences.

examples.incorrect: This feature is the icing on the cake.
examples.correct: This feature is an added benefit.

source: Microsoft Style Guide, Global Audience section

title: Avoid excessive abbreviations
description: Use abbreviations only when necessary and define them on first use.

examples.incorrect: Enable the TLS in the UI before setting the DNS.
examples.correct: Enable Transport Layer Security (TLS) in the user interface (UI) before setting the Domain Name System (DNS).

title: Avoid redundant words
description: Eliminate repeated or unnecessary modifiers to make sentences concise.

examples.incorrect: The software update is absolutely essential.

title: Use positive statements
description: Phrase statements positively instead of negatively to make them clearer and more encouraging.

examples.incorrect: Do not forget to save your work.

title: Avoid vague pronouns
description: Make sure every pronoun clearly refers to its intended noun.

examples.incorrect: After installing the update, restart it.
examples.correct: After installing the update, restart the application.

title: Limit prepositional phrases
description: Too many prepositional phrases can make a sentence long and confusing. Simplify where possible.

examples.incorrect: The instructions for the completion of the installation of the program are in the manual.

title: Use descriptive headings
description: Headings should clearly describe the content that follows.

title: Eliminate nominalizations
description: Use the verb form of a word instead of the noun form to make sentences more direct.

examples.incorrect: The implementation of the feature improved performance.

title: Avoid overly technical explanations
description: Use the simplest explanation possible for the audience without sacrificing accuracy.

examples.incorrect: The algorithm applies a Fourier transform to the time-domain signal to obtain its frequency components.
examples.correct: The software converts the signal into its frequency components for analysis.
